Sticky Notes
  • Models Module
  • View page source

Models Module

Django models for the Sticky Notes application.

This module defines the data models for creating and managing sticky notes and their authors.

class stickynotes.models.Author(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing an author of sticky notes.

An author has a name and a unique email address.

name

The name of the author (max 100 characters).

Type:

str

email

The unique email address of the author.

Type:

str

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

email

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
stickynote_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class stickynotes.models.StickyNote(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Model representing a sticky note.

A sticky note contains a title, content, timestamps for creation and updates, and an optional author reference.

title

The title of the sticky note (max 200 characters).

Type:

str

content

The main content/body of the sticky note.

Type:

str

created_at

Timestamp when the note was created.

Type:

datetime

updated_at

Timestamp when the note was last updated.

Type:

datetime

author

Optional foreign key reference to the note’s author.

Type:

Author

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

author

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

content

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.
